title: Machine Learning Fundamentals Quiz
description: Test your understanding of machine learning core concepts, algorithms, and applications
subject: Machine Learning

questions.question: What is the primary requirement for supervised learning?
questions.explanation: Supervised learning requires labeled datasets where each training example has a corresponding output label to learn from.

questions.question: Machine learning models always improve with more training data.
questions.explanation: While more data often helps, there are diminishing returns and potential issues like overfitting or poor quality data that can harm performance.

questions.question: Match each learning type with its primary characteristic:
questions.explanation: Each learning paradigm has distinct characteristics: supervised learning uses labeled data, unsupervised learning finds patterns in unlabeled data, and reinforcement learning uses rewards/penalties.

questions.question: What type of machine learning is used for predicting continuous numerical values?
questions.explanation: Regression algorithms predict continuous numerical values, while classification predicts discrete categories.

questions.question: Unsupervised learning requires labeled training examples to discover patterns.
questions.explanation: Unsupervised learning works with unlabeled data. If it required labels, it would be supervised learning.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of reinforcement learning?

options.text: Game-playing AI that learns from wins and losses

questions.explanation: Game-playing AI that learns from wins (rewards) and losses (penalties) is a classic example of reinforcement learning.

questions.question: Classification algorithms always output binary (yes/no) results.
questions.explanation: Classification can be binary (two classes) or multi-class (more than two classes).

questions.question: What is the main purpose of clustering in unsupervised learning?

options.text: To group similar data points together
To classify data into known categories

questions.explanation: Clustering groups similar data points together based on their characteristics, without requiring pre-defined categories.

questions.question: Reinforcement learning is primarily used for problems involving sequential decision-making.
questions.explanation: Reinforcement learning excels at sequential decision-making problems where actions taken now affect future outcomes, such as game playing, robotics, and autonomous systems.

questions.question: What distinguishes supervised learning from unsupervised learning?

options.text: Supervised learning uses neural networks, unsupervised doesn't
Supervised learning uses labeled data, unsupervised uses unlabeled data
Supervised learning is faster than unsupervised
Supervised learning only works with images

questions.explanation: The key distinction is that supervised learning uses labeled training data (input-output pairs), while unsupervised learning works with unlabeled data to discover patterns.
